trans-unit.source: Contains fields that identify an implicit resource key.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey> class contains fields that identify an implicit resource key.
An implicit resource is assigned to a control in the following form:
During page parsing, an implicit resource is converted into explicit keys in the form [*filter*:]*prefix*.*property*[.*subproperty*].
Any resource values with the specified prefix (in the preceding example, a prefix of `Welcome`) are assigned to the matching control properties.
For example, suppose values exist in the resource file or source code for the following keys:
These values are assigned to their respective control properties.
Implicit resource keys can reference only local resources.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey"></xref> class with the specified values for the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Filter"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.KeyPrefix"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Property"></xref> properties.
The filter value of an implicit resource key.
The prefix for identifying a group of properties.
A property and subproperty, if provided, for an implicit resource key.
Gets or sets the filter value of an implicit resource key.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Filter%2A> property refers to the value before the colon (:) in an expression.
For example, suppose you had an implicit resource in the following form:
This resource contains three keys that potentially have localized resource values to retrieve from the resource file or source code.
One of these keys is `Ie:Welcome.Text`, in which "Ie" is the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Filter%2A> value.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the filter value for the implicit resource expression.
Gets or sets the prefix for identifying a group of properties.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.KeyPrefix%2A> property ties together a collection of properties that can be assigned to a control.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.KeyPrefix%2A> property refers to the value after the colon (:) in an expression, if present, and before the first period (.).
For example, suppose you had an implicit resource in the following form:
This resource contains three keys, `Welcome.Text`, `Ie:Welcome.Text`, and `Welcome.Forecolor`, that potentially have localized resource values to retrieve from the resource file or source code.
Each key has `"Welcome"` as the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.KeyPrefix%2A> value.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the prefix for an implicit resource expression.
Gets or sets a property and subproperty, if provided, for an implicit resource key.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Property%2A> property specifies the control property to be localized.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Property%2A> property refers to the value after the first period (.) in an expression.
For example, suppose you had an implicit resource in the following form:
This resource contains three keys, `Welcome.Text`, `Ie:Welcome.Text`, and `Welcome.Forecolor`, that potentially have localized resource values to retrieve from the resource file or source code.
Those keys have <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ImplicitResourceKey.Property%2A> values of `"Text"`, `"Text"`, and `"Forecolor"`, respectively.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the property and subproperty for an implicit resource expression.
